noun.description: A small free-swimming crustacean with an elongated body, typically marine and frequently harvested for food.

examples: some families still go shrimping off the coast at Lytham
at Trebetherick you paddle on Daymer Bay or shrimp off Gully

origin: Middle English: probably related to Middle Low German schrempen to wrinkle, Middle High German schrimpfen to contract, also to scrimp.
